WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description:
There is a useful #warning directive in C#: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/963th5x3.aspx

Basically one can mark a problematic a line of code that cannot be addressed immediately with a warning message. This warning message would go to the output every time  the project is compiled so there is no way they will forget about that problem.


In addition to that you may want to consider making TODO and HACK keywords work in comments so that those comments pop up in the Task list window in VS.
WorkItem.Summary: Feature request: add the warning directive

Comments.Message: Added to the list of suggestions for a future release.
